result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica R Irish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jessica R Irish is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jessica R Irish was found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall abide by CHIPS order, if in effect.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jessica R Irish in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jessica R Irish.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant to plead to Count 1 with WSPS 2 years (1&1), costs, DNA, consecutive to other sentences. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives her rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1. Court explains felony loss of rights. PSI not requested. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 dismissed. State heard. Attorney Kieler heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders WSPS 3 years (18mo&18mo), consecutive to vacated sentences, with conditions: Counseling, take medications as prescribed, abide by CHIPS order if in effect, costs, DNA, all imposed and stayed with 3 years probation and same conditions. No credit.
to Court re: 9/7/22 hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jessica R Irish appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Jessica R Irish. Court questions status of case. Attorney Kieler heard. New plea offer to be reviewed with client. Attorney Kieler and defendant go to breakout room to review offer and return. Per Attorney Kieler, nothing definite decided at this point. Attorney Kieler will notify court tomorrow after speaking with client further.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessica R Irish appeared in court, Attorney Ryan Kieler for Jessica R Irish appeared in court, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Matthew Small sworn and testified. Cross. Comments heard. Court heard and finds probable cause to bind matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.

Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Jessica R Irish appeared in court, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD--does not qualify. State requests signature bond. Court sets $1000 signature bond with a condition to contact SPD office today. Preliminary hearing set.
